item.title: TikTok goes offline in the US hours before ban due to come in
item.description: A message appearing for US users said a law banning TikTok had been enacted, meaning "you can't use TikTok for now".

item.title: Thousands protest in Washington against Trump as he prepares for inauguration
item.description: The march took place ahead of Trump's arrival to the nation's capital as he prepares to be sworn in on Monday.

item.title: Statue of Spanish conquistador reinstalled in central Lima
item.description: The controversial sculpture was unveiled at a ceremony marking 490 years since Peru's capital was founded.

item.title: Medics under siege: 'We took this photo, fearing it would be our last'
item.description: El-Fasher's last functioning hospital records 28 deaths in the last month after being targeted by shells.

item.title: Trump launches cryptocurrency with price rocketing
item.description: Hours after its launch, the market capitalisation for $Trump reached nearly $5.5bn (Â£4.5bn).
